conclusion: Analyze the motion of the charged particle in both magnetic and electric fields to calculate the time taken from origin to point P.

Coordinate plane with particle injected from origin O at 45° angle to y-axis, moving through magnetic field in fourth quadrant and electric field in first quadrant, reaching point P (3L, L) with velocity along positive x-axis with magnitude V_0.
Particle moves in magnetic field first, following a circular path due to Lorentz force.
Initial velocity components are v_{0x} = v_{0y} = V_0/sqrt(2) due to 45° injection angle.
Magnetic force balances centrifugal force, leading to radius r = mv_0/(qB).
Particle moves a quarter of the circle in magnetic field, distance traveled is (pi r)/2 = (pi mv_0)/(2qB).
In electric field, particle moves along x-axis with velocity V_0, distance traveled is 3L.
Total distance traveled is sum of distances in both fields: (pi mv_0)/(2qB) + 3L.
Time taken is total distance divided by velocity in electric field: [(pi mv_0)/(2qB) + 3L]/V_0.
Simplifying gives time taken as (pi mv_0 + 6qBLV_0)/(2qBV_0).
Given qBLV_0/m = V_0^2/2, time simplifies to pi/2.
